revised_title: Quantum Vacuum Energy in Two-Dimensional Space-Times: Renormalization Theory and Casimir Effect
tldr: This article presents a detailed study of the renormalization theory of the energy-momentum tensor of a two-dimensional massless scalar field. The authors generalize the method to include the Casimir effect in spatially finite models and apply it to space-times of constant curvature. The results reveal that different vacuum states are associated with distinct conformal coordinate systems, highlighting the challenges in defining observables and classifying states in curved-space quantum field theory.
